feed.title: Newest questions tagged electron - Stack Overflow
feed.subtitle: most recent 30 from stackoverflow.com

entry.title: Electron ERROR Error: Cannot find module 'mysql' Require stack:
entry.summary:
My Electron app uses a nodejs dependency (in my case it's mysqljs) and it works fine when running on development mode.

However when I build it and launch as a native desktop app, it fails with:

Electron ERROR Error: Cannot find module 'mysql' Require stack: ...

entry.title: What is the purpose of "typeof" in members in TypeScript typings?
entry.summary:
The Electron typescript definitions contain the following interface:

interface MainInterface extends CommonInterface {
  // I understand these
  app: App;
  autoUpdater: AutoUpdater;
  // But not these
  BrowserView: typeof BrowserView;
  BrowserWindow: typeof BrowserWindow;
  ClientRequest: typeof ClientRequest;
  ...
}

What does typeof XX mean in this context? AFAIK typeof returns the string name of the type, e.g. the above is equivalent to

BrowserView: "BrowserView";

If this is the case, then what is the purpose of the member definitions that use typeof?

entry.title: Writing configuration file for preinstall script to read
entry.summary:
I have an electron app I want to build in pkg for macOS

The use case requires the application to read a configuration file while installation to change some parameters at the time of installation

I'm not sure what will be the type of config file and how to read it through my preinstall script.

I researched and came up with a solution to use a preinstall script that reads the config file and changes the parameters in the application.

I tried finding a sample configuration file to feed my preinstall script but didn't find any.

Any learning resource, a sample of the config file and preinstall script would be appreciated.

The pre-install script should be able to read the arguments from the config file passed as an installer parameter like:

sudo installer pkg target / -someConfigFile

and change some parameters in my application

entry.summary:
I would like to create a file list that like the following:

As long as I input multiple files into a section, it will make a LIST that contents the files.

Is there any nodejs module or javascript to do that in Electron?

entry.title: VS Code DevTools Dark Theme has black console text on dark backgrounds
entry.summary:
I switched the Chrome/Electron DevTools Theme to Dark (in the DevTools Settings, under Preferences), so that it doesn't glare late at night.

But the console text is rendered black still, which is difficult to read on the dark backgrounds for Errors or Warnings:

Is there a setting for the DevTools themselves that I should look into, or is this an Issue I should raise in VS Code? Or Electron?

entry.title: Problem with open new browser using router in Vue/Electron. Redirecting to default route
entry.summary:
I'm trying to open a new window using Vue/Electron but the new windows is opening on default rounte instead the needed route.

*The route on navigation-drawer is working well.

file: router/index.js

import Process from '@/components/ProcessManager/Process.vue'
export default new Router({
  routes: [
    {
      path: '/',
      name: 'home',
      component: require('@/components/LandingPage').default
    },
    {
      path: 'process',
      name: 'process',
      component: Process,
    },
    {
      path: '*',
      redirect: '/'
    }
  ]

file:main/index.js

const processURL = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development'
  ? `http://localhost:9080/#/process`
  : `file://${__dirname}/index.html#process`

function createWindow2 () {
  let win = new BrowserWindow({ width: 400, height: 320, webPreferences: {webSecurity: false} })
  win.loadURL(processURL)
  win.on('closed', () => {
    win = null
  })
}

entry.title: How to path to an image file in an electron app?
entry.summary:
I am creating an electron app and packaging for distribution with electron-builder for windows and Mac. This app creates a folder and some pdfs inside varying based on user input. The pdfs also use an image, which as a node app I was keeping in the root folder of the app.

I managed to write to the desktop using an absolute path.

 if (!fs.existsSync(`/Users/${user}/Desktop/2019 Certificates`)){
        fs.mkdirSync(`/Users/${user}/Desktop/2019 Certificates`);
    }

but when I use this relative path 

stampandseal.png

I get the following error:

I expect it to find the png relative to the js file, however I get the following error:

fs.js:121 Uncaught Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'stampandseal.png'

entry.title: usb_bindings.node' was compiled against a different Node.js version
entry.summary:
I've got an error message saying:

'/home/mago/dev/nodejs/indicate/node_modules/usb/build/Release/usb_bindings.node' was compiled against a different Node.js version using NODE_MODULE_VERSION 64. This version of Node.js requires NODE_MODULE_VERSION 70. Please try re-compiling or re-installing the module (for instance, using npm rebuild or npm install).

I'm using Electron with node@10.15.0 also I'm using a module which is using usb module. I've tried npm install and rebuild. I've updated to node-gyp@5.0.0 and rebuilt the module. But the error is still the same.

entry.title: Electron application doesn't showing browser alerts
entry.summary:
In Electron Framework I have load the url of an external web application and everything works fine except for browser alerts (the web application's JavaScript alert). During the alert, it causes errors in the console.

app.on('ready', function() {

  mainWindow = new BrowserWindow({
    'width': 800,
    'height': 600,
    'webPreferences': {'plugins': true,'devTools':false,'allowRunningInsecureContent':true},
    'title': 'Teklix, Inc.',    
    'backgroundColor': '#002b36', 
    'center' : true,
    'minWidth' : 400,
    'minHeight' : 300,
    'icon': icon_file,
    'resizable' : true,
    'alwaysOnTop' : false,
    'kiosk':false,      

  });

 mainWindow.loadURL('https://example.com/index'); //external Web app URL


});

Please see the versions that I have used,

Node.js 10.11.0

Chromium 69.0.3497.128

Electron 4.1.0

Can you please help me to solve this issue?

When i load my app the page appears as normal but checking inspect element. all javascripts on the site don't load.

entry.title: Import component from a variable path name
entry.summary:
I need to concatenate at string which contents the path to a vue file and import this one.

I've tried the following code:

const electron = require('electron');
const fs = require('fs');
// let electron know which OS is used and get the right path, the path is different on each OS.
const userDataPath = (electron.app || electron.remote.app)
    .getPath('appData');

let import_path = userDataPath + '/Test.vue';

import test from import_path;

/src/renderer/router.js
Module build failed (from ./node_modules/babel-loader/lib/index.js):
SyntaxError: Unexpected token (15:17)

  13 | let import_path = userDataPath + '/Test.vue';
  14 | 
> 15 | import test from import_path;

How can I import the vue file?

entry.title: Transfer electron renderer process to default browser
entry.summary: I want to switch my electron app to the browser tab. Is it possible to do so like switching the renderer process to the default browser and communicate with the electron main process?

entry.title: Electron form - import data
entry.summary:
I'm coding my first app in Electron.js Today I have implemented a Login Form but after study hours, only with ipcMain I resolve and I import username and password. Now, I have a Database in localhost that I use for save the Users. I'm trying to find in db a username that I insert in my username field in form, but when I call function .query the result is 'undefined' and I'm going crazy with this form, there are two days that I try to implement this but there was a bad idea!! Pls enlighten my way!!

  • I try to connect with db with mysql.createConnection()
  • I try to connect with the login form with ipc method
  • I try to research in my db if username exist

main.js

var mysql = require('mysql')
const { app, BrowserWindow, ipcMain } = require('electron');
const path = require ('path');
const fs = require('fs');
const os = require('os');

let win;          // window
var connection;   // connection


// create first BrowserWindow of my app (login page)
function creaPagina () {
  win = new BrowserWindow({
    width: 800,
    height: 600,
    show: false,
    webPreferences: {
      webSecurity: true,
      nodeIntegration: true
    }
  })
  win.loadFile("index.html")
}
app.on('ready', creaPagina)


// connection with DB
connection = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "****",
  user: "****",
  password: "****",
  database: "App-db"
});
connection.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err
  console.log("Connected!")
});


// connection with my form for import username and pass
ipcMain.on('form-submission', function (event, username, password) {
  console.log("this is the username from the form ->", username)
  console.log("this is the password from the form ->", password)

  var query = "SELECT * FROM Users WHERE username = " + username + "";
  connection.query(query, function (err, result) {
    console.log(result)  // undefined WTF ???
  });
});

renderer.js

const ipcRenderer = require('electron').ipcRenderer;

function sendForm(event) {
    event.preventDefault()
    let username = document.getElementById("username").value;
    let password = document.getElementById("password").value;
    ipcRenderer.send('form-submission', username, password);
}

index.html

<body>
    <form name="ipcForm" onSubmit="JavaScript:sendForm(event)">
      <input type="text" id="username" name="username" placeholder="Username" required>
      <input type="password" id="password" name="password" placeholder="Password" required>
      <input type="submit" name="submit" value="SIGN UP">
    </form>
    <script src='renderer.js'></script>
</body>

Query to find username in db:

Result --> undefined

entry.title: Electron: files copied from asar are readonly
entry.summary:
I have an electron app, and when I build it for distribution, the actual app code and build folder are on app.asar file. During the app runtime, I have to copy certain files from the app.asar onto the user's computer, wherever the user chooses, and modify with the code.

The problem is that whenever the file is copied, it becomes readonly, and thus I can not write to it. Any way to handle this?

entry.title: What does electron autoUpdater download?
entry.summary:
do not wish to download full application for a small update in electron application

I have found out that replacing the app.asar file in my electron app's resources directory , updates the "code-specific-updates" in my application , is this enough for an update or autoUpdater does something extra to update the application ?,

"code-specific-updates" refer to renderer and html changes I have also tried using squirrel for windows , but cannot use it because it does not allow me to install application to custom directory (Program Files in my case)

entry.title: Package Electron app with dependent packages such that only the dist/ folder of each package is included
entry.summary:
For instance, an Electron app that I'm building uses Zurb Foundation whose npm module is ~25MB. The app itself just uses their CSS and JS files. So while creating the distributable package, I would like the node_modules/foundation-sites to only include its dist/ folder where the relevant production files are stored.

Is there a standard practice for this, other than physically deleting the irrelevant files or using the --ignore option with electron-packager?

entry.title: Text-To-Speech without browser GUI
entry.summary:
I have been designing in HTML to create an application that has a GUI. I have created a few scripts for this - particularly one that uses the browser window Speech Synthesis Utterance.

Suddenly, however, the scope of the project has changed and I need to do away with the GUI, but keep the TTS script running as a background process. I'm still quite new to programming, so I tried opening the script with node.js, but it didn't work like that. The utterance is programmed to read a certain xml file. So essentially, all I want to do is to do away with the HTML browser aspect, and keep the javascript. Is this possible? Does anyone have any suggestions on how I could approach this?

I've tried opening the script solely in node.js I've looked into element.js but it doesn't "seem" to be what I am after.

            var msg = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance("Testing");


            var voices = window.speechSynthesis.getVoices();
            var voice = speechSynthesis.getVoices();
            speechSynthesis.getVoices().forEach(function(voice) {
                console.log(voice.name, voice.default ? voice.default : '');
            });

            msg.pitch = 1.1;
            msg.volume = 1;
            msg.rate = 0.85;
            msg.lang = 'en-US';
            msg.voice = voices[1];
            window.speechSynthesis.speak(msg);

Actual results - Opens a web browser and begins talking (there's a html file) Expected results I want - No web browser, just talk when the file is opened (maybe?)

entry.title: Sending response to ipcRenderer from ipcMain after asynchronous operation completes
entry.summary:
I'm learning Electron by writing the app that should parse and analyze .csv files. As a frontend part of it I'm using Vue.js. Initial functionality should be next: user selects a file, main process parses it, file's summary displayed at the client as a part of a Vue component. Code below: 

//background.js
import Analyzer from './Analyzer'
analyzer = new Analyzer();

ipcMain.on('data:upload', (event, data) => {
    let options = {
      filters: [{ 
        extensions: ['csv']
      }] 
    };
    let filepath = dialog.showOpenDialog(options);
    analyzer.loadDataCSV(filepath);  //executes async code
    event.sender.send('data:upload', analyzer.getState());// doesn't wait
})                                                        // async code to be completed 
                                                          // so the 'state' I'm sending 
                                                          // is actually incorrect


//Analyzer.js - class that i've wrote
import csv from 'fast-csv'
...
loadDataCSV(filepath) {
    if (!filepath) return;
    this.dataWSFilepath = filepath;
    this.showDataCard = true;
    let rowsCount = 0;
    csv. //async part
        fromPath(filepath, { delimiter: "|" })
        .on("data", function (data) {
            if (data[9] == 'NCR') rowsCount++;
        })
        .on("end", function () {
            this.NCRCount = rowsCount //Variable I'm expecting to be 
                                      //changed inside the Vue component
        });
}
getState(){ return { NCRCount: this.NCRCount }}
...

Please tell me the right way to wait the async part of loadDataCSV() to be completed before sending answer to ipcRenderer.

entry.title: Electron and cdn links
entry.summary:
Is it possible to use cdn links in renderer? I am using 

<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/nerdamer@0.7.16/nerdamer.core.js"></script>

in an standalone index.html and working as intended but when I try to put this in Electron's renderer I get 

Uncaught Error: Cannot find module './nerdamer.core.js'

Interesting thing is even when I put this file locally, I get the same error.

<script src="externalLibs/nerdamer.core.js"></script>

Can you provide me some insight on this thank you...

entry.title: ipcRenderer.send() function not working inside setInterval
entry.summary:
I need explanation and a solution to why the following code isnt working in in my Electron code. 

const electron = require("electron");
const ipcRenderer = electron.ipcRenderer;

let seconds = 60;
module.exports = function countdown(){
        setInterval(function () {
            if(seconds == 0){
                seconds = 60;
            }
            seconds--
            console.log(seconds);
            ipcRenderer.send("ticking", seconds)
        },1000)
    }

All i am trying to do is just publish an event using the ipcRenderer.send() method every second, however i get an Uncaught Exception error shown bellow.

Cannot read property send of undefined at Timeout_onTimeout

entry.title: Prevent zoom on certain webview elements
entry.summary: Is it possible to prevent certain element to be effected with setZoomFactor in a webview in a window? Essentially I have an application with a canvas and various tools to manipulate the canvas, and I only want the canvas to increase in magnification instead of the tools and other UI elements. Currently the entire webview is magnified when changing the zoom factor via setZoomFactor().

not working. I also tried to add:

entry.title: How to do google oauth using angular which is converted into desktop app using electron
entry.summary:
I have an application in angular 6. I am using google oauth 2 for login using passport it is working fine but now I need to convert this app into desktop app using electron.

When I am lunching app as a electron app then google login popup is opening but it is not working because redirect url is mismatch. For example:- google redirect url is http://localhost:4200/assests/social-login.html but insted of localhost:4200/ electron is giving file:///

So how can I solve this. Is there any way to perform google authentication from electron app

entry.title: How to reduce upload time while uploading multiple files
entry.summary:
I have an directory with small files at minimum ranges from 2000 files to 10000 files.

Currently there is no methods to directly upload folder to s3 in aws-sdk-js.

i need to recursively loop through files inside folder and upload it to s3.

I used this lines of code.

const PARALLEL_UPLOADS = 10;
const q = async.queue((task, callback) => {
  s3.upload({
  Bucket: 'xxx',
  Key: task.name,
  Body: fs.createReadStream(task.path)
 }, callback)
}, PARALLEL_UPLOADS);

q.drain = function() {
  console.log('all items have been processed');
};

I used walk npm package to recursively read files inside folder. inside it i push files to queue.

  let walker = walk.walk(path);
  walker.on("file", async function(root, stat, next) {
  q.push({
     name: stat.name,
     path: root + "/" + stat.name,
 }) })

I tested with folder with size 108 MB but it having 2700 files in nested folder inside it.

it takes more than 45 mins to upload.

so how to reduce the time of upload ??? Advance in thanks.

entry.title: Saving exe file using fs.writeFile
entry.summary:
I am trying to save the exe file from https location and save it for local use. File is saved but I get this error when try to run it "' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file."

const updaterUrl = 'https://xxx.xxx.com/updates/';

function downloadUpdate(filename) {
  // filename is update.exe
  https.get(updaterUrl + filename, (resp) => {
    let data = '';

    resp.on('data', (chunk) => {
      data += chunk;
    });

    resp.on('end', () => {
      let dir = path.join(app.getPath('userData'), 'Updates')
      let p = path.join(app.getPath('userData'), 'Updates', filename)

      if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) {
        fs.mkdirSync(dir, 484);
      }

      fs.writeFile(p, data, (err) => {
        if (err) {
          console.log('Error: ' + err.message)
        } else {
          runUpdate(p);
        }
      })
    });

  }).on("error", (err) => {
    console.log("Update error: " + err.message);
  });
}

function runUpdate(path) {
  exec(path, (err, stdout, stderr) => {
    if (err) {
      console.log(err);
      return;
    }
  });
}

What am I doing wrong?

I am using a Windows 10 machine and I want the electron app to use my default printer and print without user consent.

webContents.print({silent: true});

webContents.print({'silent': true}); // Even this is not working

Example: 

  win = new BrowserWindow({
    width: 800,
    height: 600,
    webPreferences: {
      nodeIntegration: true
    }
  })

  // url has typo 
  var url = __dirname + "indez.html";

  win.loadFile(url);

entry.title: Electron BrowserView Renderer process vs WebView
entry.summary:
I am porting an electron app from a traditional renderer + webview structure to BrowserView objects. The application uses some Browserwindows to display a webview fullscreen in all available monitors. The renderer processes hold basically an index.html with a webview at 100% size.

I am little confused about the renderer process and the BrowserViews.

With the new approach, I just inject the preloader in the BrowserView constructor, and do not load any page on the BrowserWindow themselves:

            browserViewOptions = {
                webPreferences: {
                    preload: (__dirname + "/preload.js"),
                    partition: "persist:ns",
                    nodeIntegration: false,
                    plugins: false
                }
            };

  • What renderer process is this? Is it the traditional render process where the WebViews used to be? Or do the BrowserViews have their own renderer process? If it is the traditional, is it shared in the case I also load a page in the BrowserWindow?

  • Does it make a difference the fact that i am not loading a page on the BrowserWindow? I mean, if I don't load a page on the BrowserWindow (just create the window for attaching BrowserViews), is there anyways another chromium process with an empty page running? If yes, can this be prevented if I am only interested in the BrowserView? Are there "overdraw" issues if I keep stuff on the browserwindow and occassionally hide the browserviews to display them?

entry.title: Windows-Build-Tools cannot download python
entry.summary:

Downloading python-2.7.15.amd64.msi
Error: getaddrinfo EAI_AGAIN www.python.org:443
Downloading Python failed. Error: { Error: getaddrinfo EAI_AGAIN www.python.org:443
    at Object._errnoException (util.js:992:11)
    at errnoException (dns.js:55:15)
    at GetAddrInfoReqWrap.onlookup [as oncomplete] (dns.js:92:26)
  code: 'EAI_AGAIN',
  errno: 'EAI_AGAIN',
  syscall: 'getaddrinfo',
  hostname: 'www.python.org',
  host: 'www.python.org',
  port: 443 }
windows-build-tools will now exit.

npm ERR! errno 1

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:

I already have python 2.7.16 installed on my machine and I would appreciate it if there's a way to install this package without python.

I'm doing this

entry.title: Does anyone know how to make a custom bundler for Mac OS with an Electron Application and bash scripts
entry.summary:
Essentially I want to take my fully functioning Electron Application that relies on third party binaries for it's main function and want to bundle them so that the dependencies are installed with bash scripts using commands like curl and then running the binaries dependencies and then giving the user the choice to install my .app or use my .dmg installer for my electron installer.

I have already tried bundling the .sh scripts in the electron apps installation process and it's not working and it won't work so I want to see if their is a third party tool that takes my dmg and runs it after the user runs the .pkg installer for the other third party software.

#!/usr/bin/env bash 

# pull pkg from facebooks repo
curl -o dependency.pkg https://pkg.dist/dependency.pkg
# run package 
 ./dependnecy.pkg
# afterwards run the .dmg
./openproject.dmg

I don't have errors and both binaries work standalone but I just can't seem to schedule them correctly. I know I can ask the user to install the other dependency before hand but I want the experience to be seamless.
